intro: Dactylopetalum rogersii, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its smooth, reddish bark and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits containing single seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional crafts, it is also of ecological and economic significance.
